text: So, anyone doing continuous delivery?
/giphy tumbleweed
no yet
on the pipeline though
I’m trying to set it up to beta channel, but seems like it ain’t going to happen :confused:
we’re just chatting on how to automate it to a level where we send an automated email to ops when we do a change, with all the issues we’ve fixed and features implemented

when the PR is merged, call this maybe?
 <https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#list-commits-on-a-pull-request>
gather all the commit messages and put them in an email
Shouldn’t your CI tool be able to do that?
I think circle just gives me the latest commit message, not PR
tho I assume jenkins already has something that takes all the closed issues and commits and sends it
Does anyone know any good modelling tools that have Linux support and are not Visual Paradigm?

Continous Delivery set up and working, dev branch goes straight to beta. thinking I should maybe set up a staging branch (between dev and master) and make dev go Alpha and Staging to beta. any opinions?
yes that can make sense
<@U0548MM6B> to do that with my commits I’ll need to swear less in them.
Also, are you using that gradle plugin to push to play store?
yep the play publisher
real nice to set up
you just add the deployment to yml and run the task and magic happens
only problem is version name and codename preventing me from promoting beta to prod :confused:
ah shucks
there are plugins for that as well
might be, currently I’m just appending the enviroment build number onto the version code and version name
but made a beta flavor so I could have dogfood icon, name and signing
:thumbsup:
we just use build types for that, haven’t really needed flavors yet
can you define different resources for buildTypes? :open_mouth:
yep
no need for flavors
is there any point in asking `intent.getExtras().containsKey(…)` if you later supply a default value to `getIntExtra(…)` anyway?
wooo nice then
lemme try it out now

I'm looking to create an onboarding experience similar to some native google apps.  The closest library to this visually is 
<https://github.com/deano2390/MaterialShowcaseView>
however it looks like it is not actively being maintained as there are 26 open issues, 4 open pull requests, and the latest commit was 3 months ago.  Does anyone know of some good alternatives?

text: there
so just look at your threads and one or more will probably be going nuts and obviously in an ANR its your main thread
but if your threads are named that should make it clear who’s to blame
alternately if its not on another thread but is actually on your main then method tracing is the best bet

<@U04TK850N|langerhans> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/langerhans/F0ER9TL3A/-.txt|Untitled> and commented: my main thread from the trace of the ANR. That shared prefs stuff looks suspicous

text: and no, all my prefs edits are `apply()`d
hits delete a bunch
hehe
that’s a nasty one
let me try ddms
I’m guessing you are calling apply too frequently and it ends up causing a mess
sounds like a framework bug to me
you should be able to call apply() as much as you want
<@U053LEHJN>: maybe but shared prefs do post back and forth
(back and forth between the background and the main thread)
my ‘guess’ is that somehow he either ended up calling it a massive amount or more likely a shared prefs listener is taking too long but since its an ANR its hard to know
waiting for it to happen again
but it might be what you say
try shaking it violently
cause it calls apply _quite_ a bit
you can’t shake a baby but you can shake a phone
now it doesn't happen anymore
dafuq
:popcorn:
<@U0ER87PPY|ercan> has joined the channel

Hi,
anyone know what rxjava operator to use if I want to call a second observable everytime the source observable emits an item, and then return the combined result?
ex: I have an observable that emits page numbers. then for every page, I make a call with retrofit to fetch that page, then return both the page and result as a Pair
zipWith
you’ll have to have a third class that you return that will combine both though
doesn't zipWith call both observables at the same time?
<@U0548MM6B>: I do CI
Not CD
<@U0DB7PX9Q>: shit yes it does. I misundersood you.
would flatmap work?
flatmap takes result of first observable and calls another
yes, I use flatMap and instead the function I save the pageNumber in an instance variable and reference it later
although, I just realized I can do the zip inside the flatMap by wrapping the pageNumber with Observable.just ?
I’d avoid any nesting
RxJava - Solving problems you wouldn't even have since 2012
:troll:
haha
but can’t think of anything that would do precisely what you’d want
it’s a dependent call and also a zip
change the api :troll:
lol I will try
take a lesson from samsung’s book :stuck_out_tongue:
to get the page returnedi n the response too
that would be the simple solution

text: Hey so I recently have been converting all my list views over to use RecyclerView instead
Its been great so far, but I’ve been running into one issue
ListView had the ability to add dividers by default, and it doesn’t appear like RecyclerView will do that
Right now I’ve just been adding a divider in xml, but is there a better way that others use instead?
Item decorations can do that too
the only downside of decorations is that you have to manually draw them
speaking of decorations, when I implement my dividers in onDrawOver, it draws over the scrollbar too
anyway to prevent this?
Hey guys so I decided to start a project and wrapping my head around rxjava.. Anyone here knows some rxjava? Got a quick question :simple_smile:
Am working on a slideshow and wanted to do that reactively.. So the idea is indefinitely loop through certain images with a duration...
(1) query for image in (2) return to imageview (3) duration? reactively? is timer a good start? <http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/timer.html>

Hello all! I’m working on a project where I’ll be downloading files and metadata and using that information to dynamically build out the interface for an android activity. The size of the package can be quite large, but the metadata won’t be. I’m thinking I’ll use  database for storing the metadata about the file, and then just the normal storage options for internal data. I’m wondering if anyone has any suggestions for database options in Android? I’ve used SQLite and OrmLite for Android in the past, but I’m curious if there are any other options out there people recommend (or just the options I’ve posted).

Also, do you recommend I roll my own ContentProvider for something like this? The number of files could be in the 1000’s, but I’m not sure what I’ll gain from the ContentProvider since the data is not shared with other apps. Maybe just ease of query?
